lead_paragraph: Bana al-Abed, 7, has more than 220,000 followers on Twitter, where she chronicles the deprivations of a child in war-torn Syria. But she has also raised questions of authenticity.

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard and Malachy Browne contributed reporting.
byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE, MEGAN SPECIA and SYDNEY EMBER

headline.print_headline: Sympathy, Then Doubts on Girl’s Syria Tweets
headline.main: Girl Posting to Twitter From Aleppo Gains Sympathy, but Doubts Follow

snippet: Bana al-Abed, 7, has more than 220,000 followers on Twitter, where she chronicles the deprivations of a child in war-torn Syria. But she has also raised questions of authenticity....
abstract: Twitter account of 7-year-old Syrian girl Bana al-Abed, who lives in rebel-held section of Aleppo, has attracted followers from around world and drawn media attention, but it has also raised questions of veracity and authenticity; limited media access to parts of Syrian conflict makes it difficult to verify many claims, and while Bana appears to be real person, it is unclear whether her Twitter posts were created in Aleppo, and whether they are solely her work.
